descendants.content:
In this Pew poll, "Dealing with climate change" is #18 of 20 priorities Americans were asked about.
I think that's simply because few people have connected the dots between climate change and issues that they care about.

For instance, climate change has a huge toll on the economy, on healthcare costs, and it's worst for poor people of color.

https://www.pewresearch.org/politics/2024/02/29/americans-top-policy-priority-for-2024-strengthening-the-economy/

descendants.content:
This nugget from Mark Gongloff:

"Just as two-thirds of us worry about #ClimateChange, two-thirds of us say we rarely or never discuss it with our friends or family. Maybe we don’t talk about climate change now, but nothing is stopping us. The more we normalize talking about it, the likelier we are to actually do something about it. "

https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2024-08-12/harris-doesn-t-talk-about-climate-change-why

card.title: Harris Doesn’t Talk About Climate Change. Why?
card.description: Americans place global warming high on their list of worries but low on their list of voting priorities.

descendants.content:
8 million environmental voters skipped the 2020 presidential election.

"Nathaniel Stinnett [of the #EnvironmentalVoterProject] explains why increasing voter participation is essential to advancing the climate movement and shows how his team is mobilizing millions of new environmental voters — without talking about #ClimateChange at all."

https://www.realclearenergy.org/video/2024/08/06/why_isnt_the_climate_movement_voting_1049861.html

descendants.content:
Want to help turn out the environmental vote?

Opportunities at the Environmental Voter Project includes phone banking to get out the vote in swing states.

https://www.environmentalvoter.org/

(Unfortunately for introverts like me, they already have enough people writing postcards to voters; I'm working to convince myself that my fear of climate change is bigger than my fear of talking to a stranger).

descendants.content: @CelloMomOnCars A lot of people in the west say they are in favour of action to fight climate change, and might even believe they are in favour of such action, but only in an abstract way. When confronted with action that affects personal privilege and lifestyle, they suddenly become less supportive of such action.

descendants.content:
@Jgmeadows

You have a point.
Many people also don't see the connection between climate change and things that affect them personally, e.g. inflation in the grocery bills, and that their "lifestyle" is already being affected, e.g. if you have to stay indoors because of wildfire smoke.

We have a lot of dots to connect, see my reply to the post above.

descendants.content: @Jgmeadows @CelloMomOnCars We're addicted to cheap energy and convenience and we're deeply disconnected from the relationship between the biosphere and stuff. Eco-Modernism, a political philosophy, argues humans can decouple from nature. The very idea of decoupling speaks to peers. But humans are not peers to nature. I think we've come to believe our own bullshit.

account.note: working on it

descendants.content: @CelloMomOnCars It is so maddening that people don't understand the immediate need to deal with climate change. Not that these other issues aren't important, but they all pale in comparison to the worldwide havok that is already presenting from climate change.

account.note:
In my youth I was a far left, antiwar "turn on, tune in, drop out" hippie (#woodstock69). Now I'm an old hippie who no longer turns on or drop outs but still antiwar and pro whatever loving lifestyle anyone chooses.

I'm cis married for 46 years with a lifelong vegetarian son and wonderful granddaughter.

We live on a 118 acre farm in the hills of the NY Finger Lakes region where we grow tree nuts and fruit.

#nobridge #vegan #WhiteDudesForHarris

descendants.content:

account.note:
I started on Mastodon when Twitter was bought by Musk.
I'm 75, married to Bill, who is 79 for 57 years this year, have a son and a deceased daughter. I'm anti-royalty and anti-celebrity, anti-capitalist and am a anarcho-syndicalist. I love live music from classical to opera to rock, R&B, pop, jazz, experimental, contemporary etc., reading, growing food and flowers, volunteer and seek a way to live sustainably. No God's, No Masters. Science is cool too.
I will vote Green. LONDON, England

descendants.content:
@CelloMomOnCars @FantasticalEconomics
A great chunk of voters are stupid and are probably not worthy of a democracy. #MAGA appeals to them because they think for them. Blind obedience is much easier than critical thinking and problem solving. We must do what will save humanity DESPITE them by convincing enough people on the left side of the Bell Curve that global warming will kill their children and grandchildren. It has already started. Dems are not vocal enough in alarming voters.

account.note: Retired Minnesota guy wishing for climate stability for kids and grandkids. Interested in #science, especially #astronomy, #gardening , #scifi and rv traveling. Join with me at https://citizensclimatelobby.org or other climate orgs.

descendants.content:
@CelloMomOnCars

Well, many of us do prioritize the climate at the polls. We tend to be attacked and shamed by Democrats who tell us we are “voting for fascism“. Which is kind of ironic, considering that war and police are not part of a green new deal, but that’s where all the funding goes.

account.note: There will be times when the struggle seems impossible. Alone, unsure, dwarfed by the scale of the enemy. Remember this. Freedom is a pure idea. #Abolition #Vegan #Anarchy  Tyranny requires constant effort. It breaks, it leaks. Authority is brittle. Oppression is the mask of fear. #1312. The day will come when all these moments of defiance will have flooded the banks & then there will be one too many. One single thing will break the siege. Remember this. Try.
